From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Norwegian Nynorsk

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • venger

Noun

[edit]

vengar m

  1. indefinite plural of veng

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Spanish, from Latin vindicāre. Doublet of vindicar, a borrowing.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /benˈɡaɾ/ [bẽŋˈɡaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ven‧gar

Verb

[edit]

vengar (first-person singular present vengo, first-person singular preterite vengué, past participle vengado)

  1. to avenge, get even, take revenge

1Rare; now chiefly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tuteo-form for the present subjunctive.
